data.title: Warner Music U, Marketing & Events Rep
data.meta_description: Warner Music U, Marketing & Events Rep at Warner Music Group
data.text:
At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter.

We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:

Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force.

Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere.

Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future.

Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.

We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.

Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.

A little bit about our team:

Warner Music U (WMU) is the branch of Warner Music Group focused on developing artists. Our content and experiences are generated by aspiring creatives, with the intention of creating lifelong fans for our artists and labels.

Representatives receive hands-on experience in the music industry, working directly with full-time employees and artists from WMG label partners including but not limited to Atlantic Records, Warner Records, 300 Entertainment, Asylum Records, ADA, and Warner Nashville. Representatives work part-time, up to 18 hours a week, and can receive college credits if necessary.

Warner Music U is now hiring music fans with a passion for marketing, social media, promotions, and event planning for the Fall 2024 Semester as paid reps!

Interested? This should be you –

Obsessed with music, and we don’t mean one or two genres! You’re someone who can find a favorite song or artist in any genre. You may be an expert in a certain style, but you can easily geek out over any type of music.

You live and breathe marketing, and know your CTAs from your ROIs! You can think big when it comes to creating memorable experiences and events, and know how to pull in your desired crowd.

In your community on and off campus, you are able to identify potential new audiences for WMG’s developing artists and can execute measurable plans to turn them into fans.

You are well-connected within your University and know how to utilize your connections. For example, you can secure a location for an event, obtain co-sponsors, collaborate with local companies, and ensure all campus protocols are followed.

As an active user of social media, you are enthusiastic to use your personal accounts to create awareness and generate views for brand partnerships and priority artists across all genres.

Discovering new music and the challenge of promoting artists early in their careers excite you, and you can think of many creative ways to do so.

You are a self-starter who is excited about the idea of running your own projects.

Willing and able to develop and maintain work relationships.

You take pride in your work and your part in the bigger picture of artist campaigns.

Your goal is to work full-time in the music industry upon graduation.

Here you’ll get to:

As a Warner Music U Marketing & Events Rep, you’ll get to:

Plan & Execute: Your core focus on the program is to create memorable in-person events on campus, find potential fans of WMG’s newest artists, and expand the fan base of known artists. You are not shy about expressing ideas and aim for impact and measurable results.

Create: We give you the creative freedom to create online content, playlists, and experiences that help Gen Z discover up-and-coming artists, using your voice and the expertise of your school and/or market. Create content pieces promoting new releases, tour announcements, merchandise, playlists, and upcoming events utilizing your creative spin and style. You may have opportunities to attend shows and photograph or film WMG artists performing in your market.

Gain Real World Experience: Play an integral role in artist development for newly signed artists. Utilize your connections and relationships to help break them within the 18-24 age demographic through digital, promotional, and grassroots marketing efforts. Summarize outcomes, feedback, and analytics through weekly and monthly reporting.

You may also have the opportunity to:

Attend shows for WMG artists performing in your market while providing detailed feedback.

Contribute to the WMU branded social media accounts.

Meet Artists

Work with and coordinate in-person and digital experiences for our curated roster of rising artists.

Expand Your Network

Correspond with various departments and employees at Warner Music Group through the execution of campaigns and artist-involved events. Connect with your fellow reps across the country through weekly meetings and collaborative projects.

Be the Eyes and Ears of WMG

Provide valuable insights on the latest trends and music popular in your market.

About you:

HUGE passion for music, pop culture, and social media.

Open to individuals enrolled in a 2 to 4-year University or College course.

Eager to create content for your own public social media profiles (Resume Tip! Include your TikTok and Instagram handles).

Understand the virality and strategy of social media platforms and know how to create best-in-class content.

Heavily involved in campus or community activities and can effectively tap into connections to pull together successful experiences.

Professional attitude with outstanding communication, time management, and organizational skills.

Ability to meet deadlines, pay attention to detail, and work in a fast-paced role.

Work well remotely/independently without direct supervision.

Able to honor a time commitment of up to 18 hours per week.

We’d love it if you also had:

Promotional experience (radio promotions, brand ambassador, street team, or similar).

Previous marketing and/or music internship experience.

Leadership experience/skills.

About us:

As the home to 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide.

We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.

Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.

Love this job and want to apply?

Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.

Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.

Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.

Salary Range

$13.25 to 18.67 HourlySalary ranges are included for job postings where required by law. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as work experience and business needs. The pay range is subject to change at any time dependent on a variety of internal and external factors.

WMG is committed to inclusion and diversity in all aspects of our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and will evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (genetic characteristics or cancer), physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.
